title: Google to improve split-screen apps on mobile, but likely not before Android 14
description: Google will finally add an option to save paired apps, but the feature may not arrive until the launch of Android 14.

title: Nothing Phone (2) will have last-gen tech but won't lack power, claims CEO
description: In a Twitter thread, Nothing CEO reveals its new flagship phone will launch with the Snapdragon 8 Plus Gen 1 chipset.

title: AMD's RX 7600 may share a key spec with Nvidia's RTX 4060 and not in a good way
description: According to the latest round of rumors, AMD's Radeon RX 7600 might have the same VRAM as Nvidia's RTX 4060, which is definitely a bad thing.

title: Meta is developing its own AI chip - here's hoping it goes better than the Metaverse
description: Meta will be making their own AI chips - though we won't see them in action for quite some time.

title: Microsoft wants to take any MFA and 2FA worries out of your hands
description: Users with more than one authentication method will now be prompted by Microsoft to use the most secure - and it’s not SMS.

title: Are cheap cameras dead? Fujifilm X-S20 leaks suggest it'll get a big price bump
description: A wave of Fujifilm X-S20 leaks has spilled the beans on the rumored mid-range camera, but how much will it cost?

title: Apple doesn't want its employees to use ChatGPT in case they blab company secrets
description: ChatGPT might have been banned or restricted for Apple employees to keep internal secrets just that - secret.

title: 7 new movies and TV shows on Netflix, Disney Plus, HBO Max and more this weekend (May 19)
description: From star-studded movie remakes to new Apple TV Plus thrillers, there’s plenty to watch this weekend.

title: This top password manager apparently has a major security flaw that could spill all your logins
description: Popular password manager KeePass has a worrying exploit that could see your vault unlocked.

title: Pentax’s upcoming film camera has got Gen Z written all over it
description: Ricoh has unveiled more details about its Pentax Film Camera Project – and the first camera on the horizon is a fixed-lens compact.

title: Is it me or is $90 for a 2TB external SSD an insanely good deal?
description: It's beginning to sound a lot like Amazon Prime Day with some stonking deals.

title: Netflix's The Mother is officially a hit, but it's not the best thriller movie in the Top 10
description: Jennifer Lopez thriller The Mother launched into the number one spot for Netflix movies worldwide, but if you want a gripping movie this weekend, look further down the list.

title: Windows 11’s Phone Link for iOS reportedly being used to spy on iPhone owners
description: Cyber-stalkers are apparently ‘rapidly exploiting’ this Windows 11 feature to spy on iPhone users without their knowledge.

title: Internet Explorer is dying - but you can decide when to say goodbye
description: Microsoft is still killing off Internet Explorer, but will let users decide when the browser is removed from their systems.

title: 4 fun family adventures like the D&D movie on Netflix, HBO Max and more
description: After a family film night in? These four flicks will sate your desires for adventure, fun and all-round chaos.

title: Google Chrome is turning off third-party cookies for some users - but it probably won't be you
description: Third-party cookies are being deprecated for 1% of global Chrome users next year for testing purposes.

title: Sega CEO hints at raising game prices to $70 in line with other platforms
description: Sega's CEO and CFO have alluded to increasing the baseline price of games to $70 to match prices across the board.

title: Apple reveals some serious security bugs, so be on your guard
description: Three zero-days were discovered being used in the wild against iPhones, Macs, and iPad devices.

title: Windows 11 is so broken that even Microsoft can’t fix it
description: Microsoft admits it can’t fix some Windows 11 Start menu problems – and that makes us worried about Windows 12.

title: Meta is expecting another EU fine
description: Is the EU really making an example of Meta when it can just soak up the costs?

title: Apple TV 4K gets a great free 'multi-view' update for sports fans
description: You can now watch multiple MLB and MLS at the same time, keeping your eye on all the action at once.

title: Indiana Jones 5's first reviews are in, and they're not looking great
description: Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny is a few weeks away from its June 30 theatrical release, but the first round of reviews aren’t exactly pushing audiences into cinemas.

title: Your Disney Plus and Hulu TV show libraries are about to get much smaller
description: Disney is reportedly removing over 20 TV shows, including some fan favorites, from its Disney Plus and Hulu libraries.

title: Oh dear... Windows 11’s big update later this year could be a yawn-fest
description: Is 2023 going to be a rather dull year for Windows 11 users? Maybe, if the rumor mill is right.

title: Cisco is patching some small business router bugs, so patch now
description: Vulnerabilities in SMB-targeted hardware could allow hackers to remotely hijack your kit, Cisco warns.

title: Alibaba is pulling out of the cloud business
description: Chinese ecommerce giant Alibaba set to split into six units and selling off some of its businesses.

title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Friday, May 19 (game #480)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: Matter's first update won't light up your smart home, but the next one might
description: Currently rolling out, Matter 1.1 doesn't address much but may instead be a setup for the future.

title: Pixel Pro 8 leak suggests Google’s adding a feature no one will care about
description: If you made a wish-list of features you desperately wanted for the Pro 8, we’re betting this wouldn’t be on it.
